title: Turkish women in sports
text:
<a href="Turkish%20women">Turkish women</a> have an active participation in many sports branches and have several important trophies, especially in <a href="Athletics%20%28sport%29">athletics</a>, <a href="Olympic%20weightlifting">weightlifting</a>, <a href="combat%20sports">combat sports</a>, <a href="volleyball">volleyball</a> and <a href="basketball">basketball</a>.
Participation in Olympics.
Pioneers.
The first Turkish women to take part in the <a href="Olympic%20Games">Olympic Games</a> were <a href="Halet%20%C3%87ambel">Halet Çambel</a> and <a href="Suat%20A%C5%9Fani">Suat Fetgeri Aşani</a> who participated at the <a href="fencing">fencing</a> competitions of the <a href="1936%20Summer%20Olympics">1936 Summer Olympics</a> in Berlin.
Basketball.
The <a href="Turkey%20women%27s%20national%20basketball%20team">Turkish Women's National Basketball Team</a>, also known as "Periler" (The Fairies) by the <a href="Turkish%20people">Turkish</a> fans, is No 13 in <a href="FIBA%20World%20Rankings">FIBA World Rankings</a>.
Football.
Women's football in Turkey began with the establishment of the all-women's club <a href="Dostluk%20Spor%20Kul%C3%BCb%C3%BC">Dostlukspor</a> in Istanbul in early 1970s. <a href="Turkey%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Turkey women's national football team</a> was established in 1995.
Handball.
The <a href="Turkish%20Women%27s%20Handball%20Super%20League">Turkish Women's Handball League</a> was established in 1978.
Ice hockey.
<a href="Turkish%20national%20women%27s%20ice%20hockey%20team">Turkish national women's ice hockey team</a> was established in 2006.
Tennis.
Some notable Turkish female tennis players include:
Volleyball.
National teams.
The <a href="Turkey%20women%27s%20national%20volleyball%20team">Turkish Women's National Team</a> is also known as "Filenin Sultanları" (Sultans of the Net).
Club teams.
<a href="Fenerbah%C3%A7e%20Women%27s%20Volleyball">Fenerbahçe</a> won the <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20CEV%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League">2011–12 CEV Women's Champions League</a>. <a href="Vak%C4%B1fbank%20Spor%20Kul%C3%BCb%C3%BC">Vakıfbank</a> is the winner of the <a href="2013%20FIVB%20Women%27s%20Club%20World%20Championship">2013 Club World Championship</a> and the <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20CEV%20Women%27s%20Champions%20League">2012–13 CEV Champions League</a>. <a href="Bursa%20B%C3%BCy%C3%BCk%C5%9Fehir%20Belediyespor%20Women%27s%20Volleyball">Bursa Büyükşehir Belediyespor</a> won the <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20CEV%20Women%27s%20Challenge%20Cup">2014–15</a> <a href="CEV%20Women%27s%20Challenge%20Cup">CEV Women's Challenge Cup</a>.
Water polo.
